data.question: What solid state techniques were used to synthesize CuF2(pyrazine)?
Why is CuF2 less soluble in water compared to CuCl2 or CuBr2?
data.answer: Due to the chemistry of the fluoride ion being considerably different from chloride or bromide.

data.question: Is CuF2(pyrazine) isostructural with other CuX2(pyrazine) compounds?
What is the bond angle for Cu–F2–Cu in CuF2(pyrazine)?
What method was used to solve the crystal structure of CuF2(pyrazine)?
What is the primary exchange in CuF2(pyrazine) according to DFT calculations?
Does the Cu–F2–Cu exchange dominate in CuF2(pyrazine)?
What is the peak temperature in the w(T) curve for CuF2(pyrazine)?
What synthetic method was used for CuF2(44bpy)?
Is the magnetic behavior of CuX2(pyrazine) family described by a rectangular model?
What is the estimated Jpyz value for CuF2(pyrazine)?
Does CuF2(pyrazine) exhibit a phase transition down to 12 K?
What is the role of high pressure in the synthesis of CuF2(pyrazine)?
data.answer: It enables the preparation of new coordination polymers.

data.question: What is the significance of the Cu–X bond length increasing with cooling?
data.answer: It makes the two copper halide bonds more equivalent at low temperature.

data.question: Is the Cu–F2–Cu chain motif retained in CuF2(44bpy)?
What is the observed saturation field for CuF2(pyrazine)?
What does the smaller ionic radius of the fluoride ion affect in CuF2(pyrazine)?
data.answer: It leads to a larger Cu–X–Cu bond angle and closer layers.

data.question: Can the Cu–X2–Cu path's magnetic exchange be probed by holding the Cu–pyz–Cu interaction constant?
What is the primary magnetic exchange path in CuF2(pyrazine)?
Does the Cu–F2–Cu exchange dominate the magnetic behavior in CuF2(pyrazine)?
